definition: to capsize/to collapse/to overturn/to overthrow/to undermine
to overturn/to collapse/to lean/to tend/to incline/to pour out

sentences.english: This is one of the important reasons for overturn of ro-ro ships.
sentences.chinese: 这是许多滚装船发生倾覆的重要原因之一。

sentences.english: Is the vessel in any immediate danger of sinking or capsizing ?
sentences.chinese: 船是否有趋于沉没或倾覆的危险。

sentences.english: A truck carrying hundreds of beehives overturned.
sentences.chinese: 一辆装有数百个蜂箱的大货车倾覆。

sentences.english: The small boat keeled over in the storm.
There was a rumor, echoed by my mother, that Fords were forever turning turtle.
sentences.chinese: 有一个我母亲也附会的谣言，声称福特车永远会倾覆。

sentences.english: Having an interior storm of doubting thoughts, Peter was sinking.
sentences.chinese: 受到内心怀疑的风暴搅扰，伯多禄险遭倾覆。

sentences.english: The capsizing of a ship in irregular beam waves is investigated by model tests and numerical simulation.
sentences.chinese: 本文介绍船模倾覆试验的结果及其数值模拟。

sentences.english: I am in danger of capsizing.
Know now that God hath overthrown me, and hath compassed me with his net.
sentences.chinese: 就该知道是神倾覆我，用网罗围绕我。

sentences.english: The boat capsized in heavy seas.
sentences.chinese: 这只船在汪洋大海中倾覆了。

sentences.english: We saw the canoe overturn, throwing its passengers into the water.
sentences.chinese: 我们看到独木舟倾覆了，把上面的乘客掀入水中。

sentences.english: There's a bus overset on the road.
sentences.chinese: 路面上有一辆倾覆的公共汽车。

sentences.english: The boat pitched suddenly and keeled over.
sentences.chinese: 船突然上下颠簸，接著就倾覆了。

sentences.english: The ship keeled over in the storm.
sentences.chinese: 那艘船在暴风雨中倾覆了。

sentences.english: The accident aeroplane was still nosed over there.
sentences.chinese: 那架失事飞机还在那里倾覆着。

sentences.english: Be careful not to capsize the boat.

definition: to overturn (a vehicle)/to capsize/to turn upside down/to change completely
(of a ship) to strike a reef/(fig.) to hit a snag
lit. to be buried in the bellies of fish (idiom)/fig. to drown
